fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.design

Interface IPageRouter


  • public interface IPageRouter
    Defines and validates routes that dynamically select a resource based on attributes of a HTTP call.
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    REFLEXE Technologies
    See Also:
    IDesignService.getRouter(), IPageRouteResolver, IPageRouteSelector

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String SETUP_URI
      Relative URI under which setup services are expected to be installed.

    • Field Detail

      • SETUP_URI

        static final String SETUP_URI
        Relative URI under which setup services are expected to be installed.

        Setup services may be installed by default but can be deactivated using configuration options (refer to the manual). Such services should be automatically uninstalled as soon as setup is complete, for improved security.

        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • resolve

        IAuthenticatedPage resolve(IHttpServiceCall call)
        Resolves the URI of a call address as an authenticated page.
        Parameters:
        call - the call address, with a session and an authenticated user.
        Returns:
        the resolved page, or null if the call address or session information cannot locate or authorize access to a specific page.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        IPageRouteResolver.resolve(IAuthenticatedPage, IDesignService, fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.auth.ITicket, IHttpServiceCall)

      • getHomeAddress

        URI getHomeAddress(IUser user)
        Gets the URI for the home page for the specified user.

        This does not require a ticket, and so can be used to build URLs that the target user can use for direct connection (for example, a link embedded in an e-mail). The default URI can be overridden by registered instances of IPageRouteSelector.

        Parameters:
        user - the user for which the home page is required. When null, the router may return either a valid URI or null.
        Returns:
        the URI for the home address for the specified user, relative to the base path. If no home address can be determined, then this will return null.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        IDesignService.getDashboard(fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.auth.ITicket), getDashboardAddress(IDashboardPage)

      • getDashboardAddress

        URI getDashboardAddress(IDashboardPage page)
        Gets the URI for the specified dashboard.

        The default URI can be overridden by registered instances of IPageRouteSelector.

        Parameters:
        page - the page providing access to the user that can view the dashboard.
        Returns:
        the routing URI, or null if the page is inaccessible.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getListPageAddress

        URI getListPageAddress(IListPage page,
                       String routeName)
        Gets the URI for a list page.

        This method variant is designed to support online construction of URIs (with a valid ticket). The default URI can be overridden by registered instances of IPageRouteSelector.

        Parameters:
        page - the page providing access to the user, the data source, and the list view name.
        routeName - optional route name, which if non-null can be used to select a non-default URI.
        Returns:
        the routing URI, or null if the page is inaccessible.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getListPageAddress

        URI getListPageAddress(IListPage page,
                       String routeName,
                       int pageItemCount,
                       int pageNumber)
        Gets the URI for a list page.

        This method variant is designed to support online construction of URIs (with a valid ticket). The default URI can be overridden by registered instances of IPageRouteSelector.

        Parameters:
        page - the page providing access to the user, the data source, and the list view name.
        routeName - optional route name, which if non-null can be used to select a non-default URI.
        pageItemCount - if specified as a positive integer, overrides the number of items per page defined by the page parameter.
        pageNumber - if specified as a positive integer, overrides the page number defined by the page parameter.
        Returns:
        the routing URI, or null if the page is inaccessible.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getListPageAddress

        URI getListPageAddress(IUser user,
                       String routeName,
                       IFetchable fetchable,
                       String listViewName,
                       int pageItemCount,
                       int pageNumber)
        Gets the URI for a list page.

        This method variant is designed to support offline construction of URIs (without a ticket). The default URI can be overridden by registered instances of IPageRouteSelector.

        Parameters:
        user - the non-null user. May be used to route the user to appropriate localized content.
        routeName - optional route name, which if non-null can be used to select a non-default URI.
        fetchable - the non-null fetchable data source or intersection.
        listViewName - the optional list view name, or null for automatic selection.
        pageItemCount - number of items per page, as a positive integer. The recommended default value is defined by the constant IDataViewService.ITEMS_PER_PAGE.
        pageNumber - the page number, as a positive integer. The number of the first page is 1.
        Returns:
        the routing URI, or null if the page is inaccessible.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        IDataViewService.getStoredView(fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.data.views.IListView, String), IDataViewService.AUTO_VIEW_NAME, IDataViewService.DEFAULT_VIEW_NAME

      • getFormPageAddress

        URI getFormPageAddress(IFormPage page,
                       String routeName)
        Gets the URI for a form page.

        This method variant is designed to support online construction of URIs (with a valid ticket). The default URI can be overridden by registered instances of IPageRouteSelector.

        Parameters:
        page - the page providing access to the user, the data source, and the key of the item for the form.
        routeName - optional route name, which if non-null can be used to select a non-default URI.
        Returns:
        the routing URI, or null if the page is inaccessible.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getFormPageAddress

        URI getFormPageAddress(IUser user,
                       String routeName,
                       IFetchable fetchable,
                       IKey key)
        Gets the URI for a form page.

        This method variant is designed to support offline construction of URIs (without a ticket). The default URI can be overridden by registered instances of IPageRouteSelector.

        Parameters:
        user - the non-null user. May be used to route the user to appropriate localized content.
        routeName - optional route name, which if non-null can be used to select a non-default URI.
        fetchable - the non-null fetchable data source or intersection.
        key - identifies a specific fetchable item, or null if the form page is required for creating a new record.
        Returns:
        the routing URI, or null if the page is inaccessible.
        Since:
        1.0

      • isValidUri

        boolean isValidUri(String uri)
        Checks a relative URI for validity. The URI will be resolved against the IHttpEndPoint.getBasePath().
        Parameters:
        uri - the relative URI, which must start with "/", and not contain special characters used when defining address spaces (such as "*" and "::").
        Returns:
        true if the URI is considered valid by the application, otherwise false.
        Since:
        1.0

      • isValidConnectUri

        boolean isValidConnectUri(String connectUri)
        Checks a relative URI, used for OTP (one-time password) authentication, for validity. The URI will be resolved against the IHttpEndPoint.getBasePath().
        Parameters:
        connectUri - the relative URI, which must start with "/", and not contain special characters used when defining address spaces (such as "*" and "::"). Additionally, it must begin at least one literal segment (to avoid conflicts between user principals and other routes), and end with two specific routing parameter segments (":principal" and ":otp"). For example, the following value is valid:
        /connect/:principal/:otp
        Returns:
        true if the URI is considered valid by the application, otherwise false.
        Since:
        1.0
